abstract: It’s been 15 years since Marc Andreessen developed Netscape, the Internet browser that introduced millions to the Internet. After its early success, Netscape was defeated by Microsoft. Now, Mr. Andreessen appears to want a rematch.
snippet: It’s been 15 years since Marc Andreessen developed Netscape, the Internet browser that introduced millions to the Internet. After its early success, Netscape was defeated by Microsoft. Now, Mr. Andreessen appears to want a rematch.
lead_paragraph: It has been 15 years since Marc Andreessen developed the Netscape Internet browser that introduced millions of people to the Internet. After its early success, Netscape was roundly defeated by Microsoft in the so-called browser wars of the 1990s that dominated the Web’s first chapter. Now, Mr. Andreessen appears to want a rematch, The New York Times’s Miguel Helft wrote.

abstract: The gap in search between Google and the combined Yahoo-Microsoft is, by some measures, not that large, suggesting Microsoft needs to improve Bing, not market it.
snippet: The gap in search between Google and the combined Yahoo-Microsoft is, by some measures, not that large, suggesting Microsoft needs to improve Bing, not market it.
lead_paragraph: Update | Aug. 15, 12:23 p.m.  There’s a clarification of the first paragraph’s math in the comments.

headline.main: The Gap Between Google and Rivals May Be Smaller Than You Think
